TopicTitle: Structural Hardpoints on Fighter jets, what can I do?

Articles.Content:
I am currently in the works of building an F-16 Fighting falcon, and I want to give it proper hardpoints. However, I can't do so, because missiles and external fuel tanks take the hardpoints with them, which ruins looks and aerodynamics. Can anyone help me find a way to get the hardpoints to stay with the plane, and not the external components? Remember, I am on console, so it may be even more difficult to find an answer.

11 hours ago, Doesntknowjackaboutps4ksp said:

I tried both, but it still detaches at the same point for me

I don't know what they are talking about, but rotating that hard points will not change how they will separate. How the separate is determined by the order they are placed with the first placement of the hardpoint being the thing it detaches from. Essentially, you will be placing your craft on your payload rather than your payload on your craft. Re-rooting will also not work as it will swap which side the hardpoint will detach from.

Quick idea:

  • Create a new craft
  • Make the missile
  • Attach the hardpoint to it
  • Attach the wing you want the hardpoint to be attached to, to the hardpoint
  • Attach a fuel tank to the wing
  • Re-root the whole thing so that the fuel tank is the root part
  • Save under a meaningful name (ex. upsideDownHardpoint)
  • Load your fighter jet
  • Load the craft you saved before (ex. upsideDownHardpoint) but instead of clicking 'Load' click 'Merge'
  • You should now have a fuel tank with a wing attached to it
  • Attach the fuel tank to whatever you want
  • Detach the wing from the fuel tank and put it somewhere in the editor
  • Remove the fuel tank
  • Put the wing back on the fighter jet
  • You can now move/rotate/etc. everything to make it more aerodynamic / prettier / etc.
  • Launch, detach the hardpoints, it should work.
